page.title: 02COURTLODGE FARM HORTON KIRBY
page.content: {Court Lodge Farm}is a 680 acre strip of land running up one side of the {Darent Valley. }The valley bottom is fertile gravel soil, but as the ground slopes up above the 100 feet contour this is replaced by light flinty soil only about 6" thick above the solid chalk. The farm grows wheat, barley, oats, peas, oil seed rape, potatoes, maize, grass, lucerne, kale and hops. Cattle are bought in the autumn and fattened on home-grown produce. In late spring the bullocks are sold for beef at 16-20 months old. The farm has a flock of about 400 breeding ewes of the Masham and Mule breeds. The lambs are fed on grass leys and on kale. They are sold fat at 3 -10 months old. The farm employs eight men and about 12 part-time women and students.
